Package utilities

Class Ray

java.lang.Object
utilities.Ray
public class Ray
extends java.lang.Object
The Ray class is used to represent a ray that gets shot from the Camera object and into the scene to look for intersections with Shape objects or Light objects.
See Also:
Camera, Scene, Shape, Light

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Vector3D direction  
    private Vector3D origin  
    private double t  
    static double T_MAX
    The T_MAX double value represents the biggest value allowed for the t variable.
    static double T_MIN
    The T_MIN double value represents the smallest value allowed for the t variable.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Ray​(Vector3D origin, Vector3D direction)
    The Ray constructor creates a new Ray object with the specified origin and the direction and also sets the t value to the T_MAX value because no intersection has happened yet.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Vector3D getDirection()  
    Vector3D getEndPoint​(double t)
    The getEndpoint method calculates the intersection point of the Ray object based on the t value.
    Vector3D getOrigin()  
    double getT()  
    void setT​(double t)

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • T_MIN

      public static final double T_MIN
      The T_MIN double value represents the smallest value allowed for the t variable.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • T_MAX

      public static final double T_MAX
      The T_MAX double value represents the biggest value allowed for the t variable. In this case 'Infinity'.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • origin

      private Vector3D origin

    • direction

      private Vector3D direction

    • t

      private double t

  • Constructor Details

    • Ray

      public Ray​(Vector3D origin, Vector3D direction)
      The Ray constructor creates a new Ray object with the specified origin and the direction and also sets the t value to the T_MAX value because no intersection has happened yet.
      Parameters:
      origin - A Vector3D object representing the origin of the Ray object.
      direction - A Vector3D object representing the direction of the Ray object.

  • Method Details

    • getOrigin

      public Vector3D getOrigin()
      Returns:
      A Vector3D object that represents the origin of the Ray object.

    • getDirection

      public Vector3D getDirection()
      Returns:
      A Vector3D object that represents the direction of the Ray object.

    • setT

      public void setT​(double t)
      Parameters:
      t - A double value that represents the new t value to set.

    • getT

      public double getT()
      Returns:
      A double value that represents the current t value.

    • getEndPoint

      public Vector3D getEndPoint​(double t)
      The getEndpoint method calculates the intersection point of the Ray object based on the t value.
      Parameters:
      t - A double value that represents the 'distance' to the intersection point.
      Returns:
      A Vector3D object representing the intersection point of the Ray object with a Shape object.
